definition[0]: a person or company that sells goods in a store
example[0]: The recession has affected most U.S. toy and clothing merchandisers.
example[1]: Cosmetics are generally sold through drugstores, supermarkets and other mass merchandisers (=large stores that sells more than one kind of product).
definition[1]: a person or company that arranges the way goods are placed in a store
example[2]: Outside merchandisers are usually brought in to create shelf displays and manage in-store advertising.
